legatusbiz wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I think I have managed to install heratrix on a Fedora Core 3 machine.
> Made some crawls and now I want to display the results - BUT HOW?

Heritrix's focus has been on the total veracity of the material
collected. Thus, its native storage format is "ARC" files, which are
essentially perfect transcripts of the HTTP responses received during
the crawl.

(Other crawlers place a higher importance on creating a website
mirror browseable from the local filesystem, or simply collecting
raw text for indexing purposes.)

See this section of the Heritrix Developer's Manual for more info,
including pointers to some tools for reading/viewing ARCs:

   http://crawler.archive.org/articles/developer_manual.html#arcs

(Other tools for ARC collection viewing are in the works, but none are
yet as easy to setup as Heritrix itself.)

> Also I'm wondering what happens if links are deleted after a second
> crawl of the sites?
> Are they deleted if not exist upon a second crawl?

Currently, any "second" crawl using the same starting/scope parameters
is completely independent of any previous crawl: there is no reuse of
known info, and even identical materials are crawled all over again.

(An initial experimental facility for revisiting the same material
according to a schedule, storing only changed material, and adapting
the revisit frequency according to perceived change rates is now
available. See:

   http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html#arf
)

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA
